intro: Lepionurus oxylepis, commonly known as the slender false nettle, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Urticaceae. It is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in clusters, which are typically borne on slender pedicels. It is native to parts of Africa and is often found in moist, shaded environments. Lepionurus oxylepis is a herbaceous perennial that can grow up to 1 meter in height.
